reporting-org.narrative: Direction-Générale Coopération au Développement et Aide humanitaire
Directorate-general Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Aid

title.narrative: Assistance alimentaire et nutrition et resilience (RDC, RAC, Mali, Irak, Syrie).
Emergency Food Assistance and nutrition and resilience activities (DRC, CAR, Mali, Iraq, Syria).

description.narrative:
Beneficiaries for the programme are identified through WFP’s monthly general food assistance (GFA). Every pregnant and nursing woman, who receives GFA in the targeted locations of the nutrition support programme, is eligible for CBT support enabling them to purchase fresh products such as dairy, meat and vegetables from selected WFP retailers.
Beneficiaries for the programme are identified through WFP’s monthly general food assistance (GFA). Every pregnant and nursing woman, who receives GFA in the targeted locations of the nutrition support programme, is eligible for CBT support enabling them to purchase fresh products such as dairy, meat and vegetables from selected WFP retailers. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities.

In line with WFP’s Strategic Objective 2 – Improve nutrition, the funding would be used to provide assistance to highly vulnerable population groups (pregnant and nursing women) to contribute to the following strategic result (2): No one suffers from malnutrition. In line with WFP’s Strategic Objective 2 – Improve nutrition, the funding would be used to provide assistance to highly vulnerable population groups (pregnant and nursing women) to contribute to the following strategic result (2): No one suffers from malnutrition. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities.
This contribution will allow WFP to provide food assistance to 68,732 beneficiaries for one month.
The objectives for this project are in line with WFP Strategic Objective 1 - Targeted food-insecure populations affected by shocks are able to meet their basic food requirements in times of crisis as well as with WFP Strategic Objective 2 - Food-insecure and vulnerable populations in conflict-affected areas have improved nutritional status. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities. The Belgian contribution of, € 1,000,000 will allow WFP to provide lifesaving assistance to IDPs in Central African Republic, under Activity 1 of its I-CSP: Provide general food distributions, nutritious food and/or cash-based transfers to refugees, IDPs, returnees and crisis-affected host communities.

There is a high risk of malnutrition amongst pregnant and nursing women in Syria, since the increase in food prices limits women’s access to fresh food such as dairy, vegetables, meat and poultry. These women may not receive adequate micronutrients essential for their health and that of their unborn or infant child. Poor dietary diversity has a profound impact that reaches far beyond the first vital 1,000 days of a child’s life which establish the foundation of the child’s future well-being.
To complement ongoing general food assistance and address the critical needs of this vulnerable group, WFP provides eligible women with cash-based transfer nutritional support (in the form of monthly fresh food vouchers) to improve their dietary diversity. Women receive an electronic food voucher to purchase fresh food products (meat, fruit, vegetables and dairy) which are not included in the general food ration basket, from WFP’s contracted retailers There is a high risk of malnutrition amongst pregnant and nursing women in Syria, since the increase in food prices limits women’s access to fresh food such as dairy, vegetables, meat and poultry. These women may not receive adequate micronutrients essential for their health and that of their unborn or infant child. Poor dietary diversity has a profound impact that reaches far beyond the first vital 1,000 days of a child’s life which establish the foundation of the child’s future well-being.
To complement ongoing general food assistance and address the critical needs of this vulnerable group, WFP provides eligible women with cash-based transfer nutritional support (in the form of monthly fresh food vouchers) to improve their dietary diversity. Women receive an electronic food voucher to purchase fresh food products (meat, fruit, vegetables and dairy) which are not included in the general food ration basket, from WFP’s contracted retailers WFP currently focuses more than 80% of its resources and capacities on life-saving interventions. Assistance is given through general food distribution linked to blanket and targeted supplementary feeding.
This contribution will allow WFP to provide food assistance to 68,732 beneficiaries for one month.
